Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sand \Sand\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Sanded}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Sanding}.] 1. To sprinkle or cover with sand. [1913 Webster]
2. To drive upon the sand. [Obs.] --Burton. [1913 Webster]
3. To bury (oysters) beneath drifting sand or mud. [1913 Webster]
4. To mix with sand for purposes of fraud; as, to sand sugar. [Colloq.] [1913 Webster]
5. To grind down or make smooth by rubbing with an abrasive object, esp. with sandpaper; to sand down. [1913 Webster]
